summary: The 5 Times When Harry Styles Was Just Harry *TEASER*
body:
The 5 Times When Harry Styles Was Just Harry *TEASER*

Harry Styles likes to consider himself a simple man. Excluding the fact that he’s an internationally known superstar. He doesn’t really like to take to that label. It shouldn’t be mistaken that he doesn’t love his job because he does. He loves to perfom. There’s nothing more exhilarating to him than to be up on stage, singing his songs and his songs being sung to him right back. He’s grateful. But he is, nevertheless to himself, just Harry. Human.

He walks in the streets of New York City, the cold wind of fall sneaking its way through his jacket, the barely-there-heat of the sunlight striking through his sunglasses. He stops by a nice cafe, almost dimly lit as it always was, and enters it. He stops just in front of the cooler, looking at the options of croissants, muffins, cookies and such. He settles on a blueberry muffin and a latte. He waits in line behind a girl who seems to be scattering her things atop of the counter.

“Sorry, I just- Give me a sec.” He can tell she feels bad although the line behind her wasn’t at all long, it was just him. She sighs and looks down, placing her hand on her forehead, “I think I might’ve left my wallet at home. I’m sorry.” He takes a step in front of her and hands the cash to the cashier. She looks up at the man who’d just paid for her coffee, giving him a stare which could only mean ‘thank you’. He nods as she puts her things back into her bag; a few receipts, a little black book, some pens and her phone.

“Hi Harry.” Cassidy the cashier greets, “Just the usual?”

“Yeah, thanks, mind addin’ a blueberry muffin with tha’?”

“Not at all.” She replies with a smile. The girl, who Harry’s paid a coffee for, waits for him to grab his order. She’s hesitent. Just for a moment though. As he walks out, she chases after him.

“Harry?” The wind blows against her face, making her hair fly just across it. Harry turns around to be met by your soft features.

“Yeah?”

“I just wanted to thank you,” you gestured to your take-away cup, “life savior, you are.”

“S'all good…” Waiting for you to answer with your name.

“Y/N, my name’s Y/N.” You lend out your hand for him to shake, in which he does, “How can I pay you back?” He pauses for a moment and smiles.

“Jus’ don’ forget yeh wallet next time, though, I won’ hold it against yeh if yeh do, I won’ complain.” You giggled and nodded as he walked away.

Harry is sweet.

summary: Little Love: Luke Part 1: An au of my fic ‘Little Love’  words 4.5k - first/second person .-.-.-. Slowly I slipped my finger...
caption:
Little Love: Luke

Part 1:

An au of my fic ‘Little Love’ 

words 4.5k - first/second person

.-.-.-.

Slowly I slipped my finger beneath the tab, pulling it open slowly as I breathed out. I wasn’t in a hurry to see it but I also wasn’t taking my time and prolonging it any longer then what it needed to be. Liz’s eyes felt like hot pokers stabbing at my skin as I started pull the thin pages out. Liz’s eyes were bad but Harry’s felt like torture. My eyes flicked up to look at him once the top of the pages was visible. His eyes were already watering and his jaw was clenched tightly as he looked down at my shaking hands.

“It’s going to be okay.” He whispered when he noticed I was looking up at him. “I don’t care what this piece of paper says, I love you and Nora so fucking much it hurts.”

“I love you too,” I whispered, tilting my head back so I could press a soft kiss to his lips.

Harry’s lips ghosted over mine, fingers flexing around mine as he kissed me back lightly. Liz was still in the room so he couldn’t kiss me as hard as I wanted him to but the smaller kisses he gave showed his love for me a thousand times stronger than his deeper, harder kisses.

Pulling away from him I took the tops of the pages back in my hand and slowly edged them out of the envelope. Harry pressed small kisses against my forehead as I breathed out shakily.

Hurriedly I read over the words at the top of the page. Whatever they were, they were scientific and medical and meant more for Liz then me and I skipped over them without a second thought. As I continued to read down the page I started to hyperventilate and I felt my heart hammer against my chest like a sharp beating drum.

Once my watery eyes find the information I want, my breath catches in my throat and Harry tenses up completely beside me preparing himself for bad news. A small sob left my mouth as I read the result and I quickly reached a hand up to cover my mouth.

“Evie?” Harry asked tensely as I continued to stare at the name that had 99.8% paternity written next to it. The paper was shaking with my hand and I had started to full on cry now. “Is it Luke?” Harry continued, his voice the tightest I had ever heard it.

Snapping out of my shock I turned to look back up at Harry, my eyes watering. “I’m sorry Harry. I’m so sorry.” I whispered, voice cracking.

Seeing that Nora was Luke’s hurt but not nearly as much as it hurt to watch the last fraction of hope flicker from Harry’s confident green eyes. He had been by me every step of the way, he had felt her kicks, been there for her ultrasounds, he had been there for everything and I could tell that he had really felt she was his.

Harry dropped his head forward and rested it on my shoulder. From the corner of my eye I watched Liz leave the room as I reached my hand up to it into Harry’s hair, pepper soft kisses against his forehead that mixed with the salty taste of my tears.

“I’m sorry.” I said again, my hand tugging at his hair gently.

I truly was. He didn’t deserve this, after everything he did for the both of us, he deserved to have the higher percentage printed next to his name, not Luke.

Harry breathed in deeply and at the same time I felt a tear drop soak the material of my t-shirt. I felt the soft caress of his hand move over my belly and I felt more tears slide over my cheek with how gentle he was caressing me.

Pulling back, he looked up at me with a heavy sigh, his chin resting on my shoulder. “Still love you, both of you. Still my little girl, she is.” His fingers scratched over my belly as he forced a sad smile on to his face.

A smile grew across my cheeks and I tugged him towards me so I could press a quick kiss to my lips. “Can already tell she loves you. Every concert I could feel her moving around, almost like she was dancing to the sound of your voice.”

Harry bit his lip and finally I saw a flash of genuine happiness in his eyes. He had said that the piece of paper didn’t matter and I didn’t real get what he meant till now. Nora reacted to him, she liked the sound of his voice, her movements told me that the sound of his voice comforted her and made her feel safe despite Harry not being her biological father.

“My baby girl.” He whispered, the warmth of his hand still on my belly, right where Nora was staring to kick.

…

Liz had to take a deep breath as she shut the door to her office. She had genuinely started to believe that Harry was going to be Nora’s dad and the broken way that Evie had apologised to him broke her heart.

She didn’t have kids herself, instead she a had a very strong connection to the most special delivers that she did and Evangeline Jones was her first and most special of them all. Oliver was not only her ex’s best friend but he was also hers and through him she met Nora and Nora was someone she could go to for absolutely everything.

She cried for a week after their death because she just couldn’t believe that two of the most important amazing people in her life were gone in seconds. A snap of gods fingers or something like that. Gone. Now she couldn’t see how their equally amazing daughter was getting completely fucked over by some douche that didn’t deserve her or the little girl she carried.

The last thing she wanted to be doing right now was to be calling said douche but she knew it was better for her to do it then Evie.

“Hello,” A deep voice answers after only a few rings.  

“Luke, it’s Dr May. How are you?”

“Um,” Luke cleared his throat and she could hear him tell someone he would be back. “I’m great, how are you? Did the results come back?”

Liz swallowed, she didn’t want to do this and for a small second, she thought about lying before deciding against it. “I’m doing well. The results did come back and congratulations you’re going to be a dad.” She wanted to add a resentful ‘again’ to the end but decided against it one more time.

“She’s, she’s mine.” He stuttered out.

“Yes, she is yours. Is there anything you want to know?” If she weren’t a professional Doctor she would have already hung up on him.

“Yes, when’s Evie’s next appointment?”

“From my understanding of the current restraining order and custody agreement between you and Evie, the only information I can give you is about your daughters health. In that regards she is okay, growing very healthily.”

“Wait, are you saying I can’t go to any of the natal appointments for my daughter?” Liz could sense that Luke was getting very angry on the other end of the phone and was very glad that Evie didn’t have to deal with this.

“You can’t have anything to do with Evie until the baby is born. This is because of a health risk to both Evie and the baby, like I said I can tell you anything you want to about the baby’s health but you can’t interact with Evie at all.” Luke could have seriously hurt both Evie and Nora that day in the hospital and she had to roll her eyes at his obliviousness to not realising his distance was for the health of his daughter.

“So, I won’t be able to be there for her birth either.” This time Luke sounded defeated and he felt defeated as well. He already knew he wasn’t going to be able to see his daughter’s entry into the world.

“London Hospital only allows two family or friends in the room at the time of the birth, which is Grace and,” she hesitated before saying the next name.

Luke already knew and he rolled his eyes, resisting the urge to swear loudly and vent all his frustrations. He couldn’t even do that because Carly was trying to sleep in the other room and he didn’t want to disturb her.

“Harry,” he said through clenched teeth. Fuck Luke really did hate him and the thing he hated most was that he was good to Evie. He was the type of good that Evie needed but he could never give her.

“Yes,” Liz slowly replied. “If you want to be there, you could talk to you lawy,”

“No,” he interrupted. If he wanted to stay in good terms with Evie he needed to keep her happy and if Harry did that he wasn’t going to try and kick him out of the room when Evie was at her most vulnerable and he definitely couldn’t kick Grace out either. “If that’s what Evie wants. Can you call me after all her appointments or if something happens?”

Luke’s mind jumped back to see Evie in the hospital bed. She had looked so scared and tired in that bed, then she was hooked up to so many different machines that he knew there was something wrong with his baby and that scared him half to death. He didn’t want her to end up back there.

“I can.” Liz felt the smallest bit of sympathy for Luke then but it quickly vanished when he remembered the shattered look on Evie and Harry’s face not even an hour ago.

…

“Hey,” Harry whispered, hand carding through my hair. “I called Luke. He’s already here at the hospital.”

“What,” my voice cracked and I forced my eyes open to look at him.

Harry was sat at the side of my bed and when my eyes groggily opened he offered me a soft smile fingers messaging my scalp. I felt tired and so sore, I was desperate for a hug from him but even the thought of him touching me anywhere hurt.

“Luke, I called him to tell him you were in labour and he said that he was already here with Carly. Their little boy was born yesterday.”

“’s not fair.” I slurred, reaching a hand up and dropping it over his. My hold was light and Harry frowned at it. Whether he was upset at my hold or the entire situation we were in I don’t know and I was too tired to think about it.

Harry shook his head and pulled my hand down to press a kiss against the back of it, careful to avoid hitting the IV. “I know but we can make the most of it. We’re married now. She’ll still have my name and I’ll be her guardian. It’s going to be fine.”

“Next one is yours.” I smiled up at him, fighting to keep my eyes open.

Harry chuckled quickly and pressed another kiss to the back of my hand. “I hope so. You’re stuck with me now Mrs Styles. Go back to sleep baby.”  

…

“Hm, you’re so perfect.” Harry said to Nora who was bundled up in his arms, wrapped tight in a pink fluffy blanket that Gemma had gotten her.

I was beyond tired and ready to go to sleep but Luke still hadn’t been in yet to see Nora and I wanted to be awake when he did. She was born only an hour ago and I already had to pass her over to someone else. It hurt my heart, I wanted to cry but I was to tired to even do that.

“I can tell Luke we need a few more hours.” Harry said, drawing my eyes from the little brown curls on Nora’s head up to his green eyes.

“No, it’s okay.” I shifted a bit so I could curl around the warmth of Harry’s back. He shifted Nora into one arm and reached back a hand to soothe it over my arm. “Want to get it over with so I can go back to sleep. Anne and Gemma don’t want to wait any longer either.”

Harry’s lips pulled up into a slight smile as he tugged the soft blanket up higher and tucked it around my neck. He had to be just as tired but he was soldiering on through it being the strong one out of the pair of us. A quick knock on the door caused me to jump and my heart beat picked up quickly and I was starting to feel sick.

“Do you want me to let him in?” Harry asked carefully, his arm tightening protectively around Nora.

I nodded at him and gave a final look at my little girl before Harry stood up and headed towards the door. My heart was still beating fast and I felt insanely nauseous. I hadn’t felt this sick since my first trimester.

Harry opened the door to Luke and I took in a deep breath to settle everything that felt off inside me. Luke looked a little pale and his hands were shaking as he slowly made his way into my room behind Harry so we were in the privacy of my room. Luke flicked his eyes up to Harry after staring at Nora, there was shock in his blue eyes.

“Do you want to hold her?” Harry asked Luke after a minute when he didn’t do anything.

I thought Luke would come in annoyed that Harry got to hold his daughter before he did but no, he was stood there like a deer in headlights not being able to decide who to look at. Luke nodded nervously and reached out his arms and very gingerly Harry transferred Nora over as I held on to a deep breath watching the interaction.

Nora fussed a little at the transfer but quickly settled into her dad’s arms as he tucked her up close to his chest. Harry swallowed deeply as he stepped backwards until he was sat back on the bed with me, his hand quickly finding mine, shaky fingers linking together.

Luke was quite for a moment, just admiring his little girl, finger stroking over her features before looking back up to me with tear coated eyes. “She’s beautiful Eve’s. Are you okay?”

“I’m fine,” I croaked out. “Tired and sore but okay.”

Five minutes hadn’t even passed and already I was desperate to have her back in my arms. I missed the warmth her little body gave me when I held her, even the smell of her and right now she felt too far away and out of my reach. Having Harry close really did help. I couldn’t imagine how I would be able to get through this without him here.

Luke nodded as he sat down in the chair that only recently had Grace in it. He cooed down at Nora and I heard her gurgle back up at him and my heart stuttered. This was going to be very difficult for me.

“It’s okay,” Harry leant over me, his voice dropping low so only I could hear him. “Just breathe, he’ll be gone in half hour and you’ll be holding her again.”

I nodded up at him, my hand tightening around his as I kept my mouth shut on what I really wanted to say. Every moment Luke held her made me feel like I was losing a bit of her love and even though it was selfish I didn’t care. I wanted to have the little perfect bundle all to myself.

“Have you thought of any names?” Luke interrupted the silence of the room.

Harry drew back from me with a tense look. Luke didn’t know I had already named her Nora, he also didn’t know that Harry and I were married and that I had changed my last name.

“Nora. We wanted Nora Anne, after Harry’s mum, but I understand why you wouldn’t want Anne but I really need her name to be Nora.” My voice cracked and I felt myself start to cry. I had my heart set on Nora and I wasn’t going to budge.

Luke sniffed and nodded at me. “What about her last name? That time at lunch, you said you wanted her to have yours.”

“I want to hyphen it with yours. Styles-Williams.”

Luke’s eyebrows furrowed and that seemed to be the first time that he forgot about the baby in his arms. “Your last name, not his.”

“Styles is my last name. We got married a few weeks ago.” I mumbled the words quietly but somehow Luke still heard me.

Luke cursed underneath his breath, running a hand over his face quickly. I could tell that this wasn’t something he expected to hear but I was happy that seemed to be the worst part of his reaction. The room was quiet for a few seconds, the only sound coming from the monitor I still had attached to my finger.

“I’m okay with Nora, I understand how important that is to you, I don’t think I can do anything about the last name. Maybe not the middle name.” Luke concentrated back down at Nora and the room was bathed back in awkward silence.

I could fight to get the middle name for Harry but not now. I was too tired and I wasn’t going to fight in front of Nora, even when she was this young.

…

Six months later:

“Do not throw up on me.” Harry said intently to Nora who was supposed to be having tummy time on the floor but was instead lying on Harry’s chest who was lying on the living room floor amongst all her toys.

Nora’s lips pulled up into a toothy smile and Harry smiled back at her despite how tense he was being with her only a few seconds ago. Shaking my head, I smirked down at the two of them over the top of the manuscript I was slowly making my way through. Harry and Nora made for great distractions.

“Once,” I said. “And it was your own fault for burping her without a towel.”

“It was Gucci,” he complained and quickly put his hand up to stop her from rolling off his chest.

A small chuckle passed my lips and Harry glared up at me beneath his long lashes. The dry cleaner got the stain out of the shirt so he didn’t have a reason to be bitter about the shirt anymore.

The little family moment we were having was quickly interrupted by a sharp knock at the door. Harry looked towards the door at the same time I did but not before he bought his hands up to drop them over Nora’s back as her smile quickly fell and she tried to snuggle into his chest.

Throwing the manuscript down onto the couch next to me I quickly hurried to the front door while Harry started to soothe Nora because the loud knocking was quickly unsettling her.

“Luke?” Luke was stood at the door, looking very frazzled and his hair had been ruffled up a lot as well. “What the hell. I told you to text before coming around.”

Luke pushed past me into the house, shaking his head quickly. “I know but I need to see her.”

“Luke she won’t go to you when you’re like this.” Hurriedly I followed behind him to where Harry was standing with Nora clutched protectively to his chest.

I had adapted to Luke being around so often again. The custody agreement was for one, three-hour visit a week but he was around three times a week to see Nora and I didn’t mind it. He was being a father and that’s all I wanted him to do.

When he came around like this, fuming and without any warning it was always a mess. Nora never wanted to go to him and she would just scream until she was blue in the face and back cradled in my arms.

“Give me my daughter Harry.” Luke seethed but Harry didn’t flinch.

“Calm down first.” Harry said evenly, hand gentle on Nora’s back.

My heart started to race as Luke’s anger grew tenfold. Nora could sense his feelings and she started to cry into Harry’s neck despite how much he attempted to soothe her.

“I don’t need to calm down she’s my fucking daughter and I want to hold her.” Luke’s hands came up and grabbed Nora around her sides trying to pull her back from Harry’s tight hold.

That was when I saw red and I shot myself across the room as quickly as possible to put myself between Luke and Nora. I didn’t care what was going on with him today, not that he ever told me what the problem was these days, but I wasn’t going to have him vent out all his issues with Nora so close.

“How many times do I have to tell you that I don’t care how often you come around to see her but you cannot see her when you’re this angry. If you want to hold her today go outside and calm down first.”

Luke scowled at me. “You can’t keep her from me Evie.”

Turning he stormed back out of the house, slamming the front door which caused me to flinch. Lifting a hand up I ran out over my face, my chest shaking with my heavy breathes as I heard the sound of tyres screeching out of the driveway.

“Evie,” Harry said softly and Nora’s loud cries drew me back to reality. Putting my hands up I tried to take her but Harry shook his head at me as well. “You need to calm down. You need to calm her down and you can’t do that when you’re like this.”

I took a few deep breathes and tried to shut my mind off from what just happened and once Harry was satisfied he passed Nora over to me. I cuddled her tight to my chest, pressing small kisses against the side of her head as I stepped back to be sat down on the couch. Harry followed, wrapping the both of us up in his strong arms as he settled next to us.

“He can’t come around when he’s like that. He could have hurt her.”

“I know,” I whispered into Nora’s hair.

She was very slowly starting to calm down but Harry was right. Luke took it one step to far, he could have really hurt her by taking her from Harry like he did but he didn’t even care. Whatever was happening in his life made him blind to the safety of his daughter.

Eleven Months:

My finger slid over my phone as if I kept looking at it I would magically receive a text from Luke. This wasn’t like him. I hadn’t seen him in two weeks. Nora didn’t seem fazed at all by the lack of visits but it was confusing me that Luke suddenly went from two visits a week to not showing up or even texting me back to see what was happening.

“Still nothing?” Harry asked, watching Nora with furrowed brows as she spooned her yogurt anywhere but into her mouth. It was dripping down her face onto her bib and coated her cheeks but she refused to let Harry help her.

“Nope,” I sighed dropping my phone down to the table. Leaning over I tried to take the spoon from Nora so she at least managed to get some food into her but she squealed and turned away from me as well.

“You’ve told him and you’ve told his mum. You can’t do anything more Evie, he needs to make the effort.” Harry picked up his own spoon from his bowl of cereal, eyes soft as he looked over at me.

I hummed resting my chin in my hands as I rested my elbows on the table. I wasn’t interested in my breakfast anymore, I felt to worried. Harry was right, I didn’t need to be worrying over this, I had done everything I could have. Nora’s first birthday was soon and I had invited Luke to come to her party but I hadn’t gotten a reply. I didn’t want Nora to look back on pictures of her first birthday and see her father wasn’t there and I felt all the weight of the situation was rested on my shoulders.

“It’s weird,” I said after a few moments of silence, my eyes watching Nora as she got sick of the spoon and started using her hands. I couldn’t even worry about the mess she was making; her mess would be easy to clean up. “He made so much drama about being in her life and he visited so much and now he’s just stopped. Something is wrong.” My eyes flicked over to Harry who looked as if he was thinking deeply into what I said.

“You’ve tried Evie, that’s all that matters. You’ve given him opportunities and he hasn’t taken any of them. His mum has tried so don’t blame yourself for his actions.” Reaching across the table Harry took my hand and gave it a reassuring squeeze.

Shaking my head, I ran my fingers over the back of his hand. “I don’t want him to hurt her.” I whispered.

Both of our eyes flicked back over to Nora and instantly I smiled. This tiny human being that was all smiles and covered in yogurt was my entire world and I didn’t want anything to hurt even if she was at an age that she wouldn’t remember ever being sad. She smiled back up at me and giggled as she put a handful of yogurt into her mouth, pride evaporating off her as if she were the smartest person in the room because of her actions.

She didn’t deserve this. She deserved to have order in her life and because of Luke and all the emotions he was going through, she wasn’t getting that. I had put all my feelings for Luke aside when she was born because I wanted what was best for her but sometimes it didn’t even seem like Luke cared. He wasn’t in the right state of mind to be a father and I felt horrible for doing this to my little girl.

What Nora really deserved was to have Harry’s name on her birth certificate and not Luke’s.

Slowly I slipped my finger beneath the tab, pulling it open slowly as I breathed out. I wasn’t in a hurry to see it but I also wasn’t taking my time and prolonging it any longer then what it needed to be. Liz’s eyes felt like hot pokers stabbing at my skin as I started pull the thin pages out. Liz’s eyes were bad but Harry’s felt like torture. My eyes flicked up to look at him once the top of the pages was visible. His eyes were already watering and his jaw was clenched tightly as he looked down at my shaking hands.

“It’s going to be okay.” He whispered when he noticed I was looking up at him. “I don’t care what this piece of paper says, I love you and Nora so fucking much it hurts.”

“I love you too,” I whispered, tilting my head back so I could press a soft kiss to his lips.

[[MORE]]

Harry’s lips ghosted over mine, fingers flexing around mine as he kissed me back lightly. Liz was still in the room so he couldn’t kiss me as hard as I wanted him to but the smaller kisses he gave showed his love for me a thousand times stronger than his deeper, harder kisses.

Pulling away from him I took the tops of the pages back in my hand and slowly edged them out of the envelope. Harry pressed small kisses against my forehead as I breathed out shakily.

Hurriedly I read over the words at the top of the page. Whatever they were, they were scientific and medical and meant more for Liz then me and I skipped over them without a second thought. As I continued to read down the page I started to hyperventilate and I felt my heart hammer against my chest like a sharp beating drum.

Once my watery eyes find the information I want, my breath catches in my throat and Harry tenses up completely beside me preparing himself for bad news. A small sob left my mouth as I read the result and I quickly reached a hand up to cover my mouth.

“Evie?” Harry asked tensely as I continued to stare at the name that had 99.8% paternity written next to it. The paper was shaking with my hand and I had started to full on cry now. “Is it Luke?” Harry continued, his voice the tightest I had ever heard it.

Snapping out of my shock I turned to look back up at Harry, my eyes watering. “I’m sorry Harry. I’m so sorry.” I whispered, voice cracking.

Seeing that Nora was Luke’s hurt but not nearly as much as it hurt to watch the last fraction of hope flicker from Harry’s confident green eyes. He had been by me every step of the way, he had felt her kicks, been there for her ultrasounds, he had been there for everything and I could tell that he had really felt she was his.

Harry dropped his head forward and rested it on my shoulder. From the corner of my eye I watched Liz leave the room as I reached my hand up to it into Harry’s hair, pepper soft kisses against his forehead that mixed with the salty taste of my tears.

“I’m sorry.” I said again, my hand tugging at his hair gently.

I truly was. He didn’t deserve this, after everything he did for the both of us, he deserved to have the higher percentage printed next to his name, not Luke.

Harry breathed in deeply and at the same time I felt a tear drop soak the material of my t-shirt. I felt the soft caress of his hand move over my belly and I felt more tears slide over my cheek with how gentle he was caressing me.

Pulling back, he looked up at me with a heavy sigh, his chin resting on my shoulder. “Still love you, both of you. Still my little girl, she is.” His fingers scratched over my belly as he forced a sad smile on to his face.

A smile grew across my cheeks and I tugged him towards me so I could press a quick kiss to my lips. “Can already tell she loves you. Every concert I could feel her moving around, almost like she was dancing to the sound of your voice.”

Harry bit his lip and finally I saw a flash of genuine happiness in his eyes. He had said that the piece of paper didn’t matter and I didn’t real get what he meant till now. Nora reacted to him, she liked the sound of his voice, her movements told me that the sound of his voice comforted her and made her feel safe despite Harry not being her biological father.

“My baby girl.” He whispered, the warmth of his hand still on my belly, right where Nora was staring to kick.

Liz had to take a deep breath as she shut the door to her office. She had genuinely started to believe that Harry was going to be Nora’s dad and the broken way that Evie had apologised to him broke her heart.

She didn’t have kids herself, instead she a had a very strong connection to the most special delivers that she did and Evangeline Jones was her first and most special of them all. Oliver was not only her ex’s best friend but he was also hers and through him she met Nora and Nora was someone she could go to for absolutely everything.

She cried for a week after their death because she just couldn’t believe that two of the most important amazing people in her life were gone in seconds. A snap of gods fingers or something like that. Gone. Now she couldn’t see how their equally amazing daughter was getting completely fucked over by some douche that didn’t deserve her or the little girl she carried.

The last thing she wanted to be doing right now was to be calling said douche but she knew it was better for her to do it then Evie.

“Hello,” A deep voice answers after only a few rings.  

“Luke, it’s Dr May. How are you?”

“Um,” Luke cleared his throat and she could hear him tell someone he would be back. “I’m great, how are you? Did the results come back?”

Liz swallowed, she didn’t want to do this and for a small second, she thought about lying before deciding against it. “I’m doing well. The results did come back and congratulations you’re going to be a dad.” She wanted to add a resentful ‘again’ to the end but decided against it one more time.

“She’s, she’s mine.” He stuttered out.

“Yes, she is yours. Is there anything you want to know?” If she weren’t a professional Doctor she would have already hung up on him.

“Yes, when’s Evie’s next appointment?”

“From my understanding of the current restraining order and custody agreement between you and Evie, the only information I can give you is about your daughters health. In that regards she is okay, growing very healthily.”

“Wait, are you saying I can’t go to any of the natal appointments for my daughter?” Liz could sense that Luke was getting very angry on the other end of the phone and was very glad that Evie didn’t have to deal with this.

“You can’t have anything to do with Evie until the baby is born. This is because of a health risk to both Evie and the baby, like I said I can tell you anything you want to about the baby’s health but you can’t interact with Evie at all.” Luke could have seriously hurt both Evie and Nora that day in the hospital and she had to roll her eyes at his obliviousness to not realising his distance was for the health of his daughter.

“So, I won’t be able to be there for her birth either.” This time Luke sounded defeated and he felt defeated as well. He already knew he wasn’t going to be able to see his daughter’s entry into the world.

“London Hospital only allows two family or friends in the room at the time of the birth, which is Grace and,” she hesitated before saying the next name.

Luke already knew and he rolled his eyes, resisting the urge to swear loudly and vent all his frustrations. He couldn’t even do that because Carly was trying to sleep in the other room and he didn’t want to disturb her.

“Harry,” he said through clenched teeth. Fuck Luke really did hate him and the thing he hated most was that he was good to Evie. He was the type of good that Evie needed but he could never give her.

“Yes,” Liz slowly replied. “If you want to be there, you could talk to you lawy,”

“No,” he interrupted. If he wanted to stay in good terms with Evie he needed to keep her happy and if Harry did that he wasn’t going to try and kick him out of the room when Evie was at her most vulnerable and he definitely couldn’t kick Grace out either. “If that’s what Evie wants. Can you call me after all her appointments or if something happens?”

Luke’s mind jumped back to see Evie in the hospital bed. She had looked so scared and tired in that bed, then she was hooked up to so many different machines that he knew there was something wrong with his baby and that scared him half to death. He didn’t want her to end up back there.

“I can.” Liz felt the smallest bit of sympathy for Luke then but it quickly vanished when he remembered the shattered look on Evie and Harry’s face not even an hour ago.

I could fight to get the middle name for Harry but not now. I was too tired and I wasn’t going to fight in front of Nora, even when she was this young.

“Luke she won’t go to you when you’re like this.” Hurriedly I followed behind him to where Harry was standing with Nora clutched protectively to his chest.

I had adapted to Luke being around so often again. The custody agreement was for one, three-hour visit a week but he was around three times a week to see Nora and I didn’t mind it. He was being a father and that’s all I wanted him to do.

When he came around like this, fuming and without any warning it was always a mess. Nora never wanted to go to him and she would just scream until she was blue in the face and back cradled in my arms.

“Give me my daughter Harry.” Luke seethed but Harry didn’t flinch.

“Calm down first.” Harry said evenly, hand gentle on Nora’s back.

My heart started to race as Luke’s anger grew tenfold. Nora could sense his feelings and she started to cry into Harry’s neck despite how much he attempted to soothe her.

“I don’t need to calm down she’s my fucking daughter and I want to hold her.” Luke’s hands came up and grabbed Nora around her sides trying to pull her back from Harry’s tight hold.

That was when I saw red and I shot myself across the room as quickly as possible to put myself between Luke and Nora. I didn’t care what was going on with him today, not that he ever told me what the problem was these days, but I wasn’t going to have him vent out all his issues with Nora so close.

“How many times do I have to tell you that I don’t care how often you come around to see her but you cannot see her when you’re this angry. If you want to hold her today go outside and calm down first.”

Luke scowled at me. “You can’t keep her from me Evie.”

Turning he stormed back out of the house, slamming the front door which caused me to flinch. Lifting a hand up I ran out over my face, my chest shaking with my heavy breathes as I heard the sound of tyres screeching out of the driveway.

“Evie,” Harry said softly and Nora’s loud cries drew me back to reality. Putting my hands up I tried to take her but Harry shook his head at me as well. “You need to calm down. You need to calm her down and you can’t do that when you’re like this.”

I took a few deep breathes and tried to shut my mind off from what just happened and once Harry was satisfied he passed Nora over to me. I cuddled her tight to my chest, pressing small kisses against the side of her head as I stepped back to be sat down on the couch. Harry followed, wrapping the both of us up in his strong arms as he settled next to us.

“He can’t come around when he’s like that. He could have hurt her.”

“I know,” I whispered into Nora’s hair.

She was very slowly starting to calm down but Harry was right. Luke took it one step to far, he could have really hurt her by taking her from Harry like he did but he didn’t even care. Whatever was happening in his life made him blind to the safety of his daughter.

Eleven Months:

My finger slid over my phone as if I kept looking at it I would magically receive a text from Luke. This wasn’t like him. I hadn’t seen him in two weeks. Nora didn’t seem fazed at all by the lack of visits but it was confusing me that Luke suddenly went from two visits a week to not showing up or even texting me back to see what was happening.

“Still nothing?” Harry asked, watching Nora with furrowed brows as she spooned her yogurt anywhere but into her mouth. It was dripping down her face onto her bib and coated her cheeks but she refused to let Harry help her.

“Nope,” I sighed dropping my phone down to the table. Leaning over I tried to take the spoon from Nora so she at least managed to get some food into her but she squealed and turned away from me as well.

“You’ve told him and you’ve told his mum. You can’t do anything more Evie, he needs to make the effort.” Harry picked up his own spoon from his bowl of cereal, eyes soft as he looked over at me.

I hummed resting my chin in my hands as I rested my elbows on the table. I wasn’t interested in my breakfast anymore, I felt to worried. Harry was right, I didn’t need to be worrying over this, I had done everything I could have. Nora’s first birthday was soon and I had invited Luke to come to her party but I hadn’t gotten a reply. I didn’t want Nora to look back on pictures of her first birthday and see her father wasn’t there and I felt all the weight of the situation was rested on my shoulders.

“It’s weird,” I said after a few moments of silence, my eyes watching Nora as she got sick of the spoon and started using her hands. I couldn’t even worry about the mess she was making; her mess would be easy to clean up. “He made so much drama about being in her life and he visited so much and now he’s just stopped. Something is wrong.” My eyes flicked over to Harry who looked as if he was thinking deeply into what I said.

“You’ve tried Evie, that’s all that matters. You’ve given him opportunities and he hasn’t taken any of them. His mum has tried so don’t blame yourself for his actions.” Reaching across the table Harry took my hand and gave it a reassuring squeeze.

Shaking my head, I ran my fingers over the back of his hand. “I don’t want him to hurt her.” I whispered.

Both of our eyes flicked back over to Nora and instantly I smiled. This tiny human being that was all smiles and covered in yogurt was my entire world and I didn’t want anything to hurt even if she was at an age that she wouldn’t remember ever being sad. She smiled back up at me and giggled as she put a handful of yogurt into her mouth, pride evaporating off her as if she were the smartest person in the room because of her actions.

She didn’t deserve this. She deserved to have order in her life and because of Luke and all the emotions he was going through, she wasn’t getting that. I had put all my feelings for Luke aside when she was born because I wanted what was best for her but sometimes it didn’t even seem like Luke cared. He wasn’t in the right state of mind to be a father and I felt horrible for doing this to my little girl.

What Nora really deserved was to have Harry’s name on her birth certificate and not Luke’s.

Little Love: Luke

Part 1:

An au of my fic ‘Little Love’ 

words 4.5k - first/second person

.-.-.-.

Slowly I slipped my finger beneath the tab, pulling it open slowly as I breathed out. I wasn’t in a hurry to see it but I also wasn’t taking my time and prolonging it any longer then what it needed to be. Liz’s eyes felt like hot pokers stabbing at my skin as I started pull the thin pages out. Liz’s eyes were bad but Harry’s felt like torture. My eyes flicked up to look at him once the top of the pages was visible. His eyes were already watering and his jaw was clenched tightly as he looked down at my shaking hands.

“It’s going to be okay.” He whispered when he noticed I was looking up at him. “I don’t care what this piece of paper says, I love you and Nora so fucking much it hurts.”

“I love you too,” I whispered, tilting my head back so I could press a soft kiss to his lips.

[[MORE]]

Harry’s lips ghosted over mine, fingers flexing around mine as he kissed me back lightly. Liz was still in the room so he couldn’t kiss me as hard as I wanted him to but the smaller kisses he gave showed his love for me a thousand times stronger than his deeper, harder kisses.

Pulling away from him I took the tops of the pages back in my hand and slowly edged them out of the envelope. Harry pressed small kisses against my forehead as I breathed out shakily.

Hurriedly I read over the words at the top of the page. Whatever they were, they were scientific and medical and meant more for Liz then me and I skipped over them without a second thought. As I continued to read down the page I started to hyperventilate and I felt my heart hammer against my chest like a sharp beating drum.

Once my watery eyes find the information I want, my breath catches in my throat and Harry tenses up completely beside me preparing himself for bad news. A small sob left my mouth as I read the result and I quickly reached a hand up to cover my mouth.

“Evie?” Harry asked tensely as I continued to stare at the name that had 99.8% paternity written next to it. The paper was shaking with my hand and I had started to full on cry now. “Is it Luke?” Harry continued, his voice the tightest I had ever heard it.

Snapping out of my shock I turned to look back up at Harry, my eyes watering. “I’m sorry Harry. I’m so sorry.” I whispered, voice cracking.

Seeing that Nora was Luke’s hurt but not nearly as much as it hurt to watch the last fraction of hope flicker from Harry’s confident green eyes. He had been by me every step of the way, he had felt her kicks, been there for her ultrasounds, he had been there for everything and I could tell that he had really felt she was his.

Harry dropped his head forward and rested it on my shoulder. From the corner of my eye I watched Liz leave the room as I reached my hand up to it into Harry’s hair, pepper soft kisses against his forehead that mixed with the salty taste of my tears.

“I’m sorry.” I said again, my hand tugging at his hair gently.

I truly was. He didn’t deserve this, after everything he did for the both of us, he deserved to have the higher percentage printed next to his name, not Luke.

Harry breathed in deeply and at the same time I felt a tear drop soak the material of my t-shirt. I felt the soft caress of his hand move over my belly and I felt more tears slide over my cheek with how gentle he was caressing me.

Pulling back, he looked up at me with a heavy sigh, his chin resting on my shoulder. “Still love you, both of you. Still my little girl, she is.” His fingers scratched over my belly as he forced a sad smile on to his face.

A smile grew across my cheeks and I tugged him towards me so I could press a quick kiss to my lips. “Can already tell she loves you. Every concert I could feel her moving around, almost like she was dancing to the sound of your voice.”

Harry bit his lip and finally I saw a flash of genuine happiness in his eyes. He had said that the piece of paper didn’t matter and I didn’t real get what he meant till now. Nora reacted to him, she liked the sound of his voice, her movements told me that the sound of his voice comforted her and made her feel safe despite Harry not being her biological father.

“My baby girl.” He whispered, the warmth of his hand still on my belly, right where Nora was staring to kick.

…

Liz had to take a deep breath as she shut the door to her office. She had genuinely started to believe that Harry was going to be Nora’s dad and the broken way that Evie had apologised to him broke her heart.

She didn’t have kids herself, instead she a had a very strong connection to the most special delivers that she did and Evangeline Jones was her first and most special of them all. Oliver was not only her ex’s best friend but he was also hers and through him she met Nora and Nora was someone she could go to for absolutely everything.

She cried for a week after their death because she just couldn’t believe that two of the most important amazing people in her life were gone in seconds. A snap of gods fingers or something like that. Gone. Now she couldn’t see how their equally amazing daughter was getting completely fucked over by some douche that didn’t deserve her or the little girl she carried.

The last thing she wanted to be doing right now was to be calling said douche but she knew it was better for her to do it then Evie.

“Hello,” A deep voice answers after only a few rings.  

“Luke, it’s Dr May. How are you?”

“Um,” Luke cleared his throat and she could hear him tell someone he would be back. “I’m great, how are you? Did the results come back?”

Liz swallowed, she didn’t want to do this and for a small second, she thought about lying before deciding against it. “I’m doing well. The results did come back and congratulations you’re going to be a dad.” She wanted to add a resentful ‘again’ to the end but decided against it one more time.

“She’s, she’s mine.” He stuttered out.

“Yes, she is yours. Is there anything you want to know?” If she weren’t a professional Doctor she would have already hung up on him.

“Yes, when’s Evie’s next appointment?”

“From my understanding of the current restraining order and custody agreement between you and Evie, the only information I can give you is about your daughters health. In that regards she is okay, growing very healthily.”

“Wait, are you saying I can’t go to any of the natal appointments for my daughter?” Liz could sense that Luke was getting very angry on the other end of the phone and was very glad that Evie didn’t have to deal with this.

“You can’t have anything to do with Evie until the baby is born. This is because of a health risk to both Evie and the baby, like I said I can tell you anything you want to about the baby’s health but you can’t interact with Evie at all.” Luke could have seriously hurt both Evie and Nora that day in the hospital and she had to roll her eyes at his obliviousness to not realising his distance was for the health of his daughter.

“So, I won’t be able to be there for her birth either.” This time Luke sounded defeated and he felt defeated as well. He already knew he wasn’t going to be able to see his daughter’s entry into the world.

“London Hospital only allows two family or friends in the room at the time of the birth, which is Grace and,” she hesitated before saying the next name.

Luke already knew and he rolled his eyes, resisting the urge to swear loudly and vent all his frustrations. He couldn’t even do that because Carly was trying to sleep in the other room and he didn’t want to disturb her.

“Harry,” he said through clenched teeth. Fuck Luke really did hate him and the thing he hated most was that he was good to Evie. He was the type of good that Evie needed but he could never give her.

“Yes,” Liz slowly replied. “If you want to be there, you could talk to you lawy,”

“No,” he interrupted. If he wanted to stay in good terms with Evie he needed to keep her happy and if Harry did that he wasn’t going to try and kick him out of the room when Evie was at her most vulnerable and he definitely couldn’t kick Grace out either. “If that’s what Evie wants. Can you call me after all her appointments or if something happens?”

Luke’s mind jumped back to see Evie in the hospital bed. She had looked so scared and tired in that bed, then she was hooked up to so many different machines that he knew there was something wrong with his baby and that scared him half to death. He didn’t want her to end up back there.

“I can.” Liz felt the smallest bit of sympathy for Luke then but it quickly vanished when he remembered the shattered look on Evie and Harry’s face not even an hour ago.

…

“Hey,” Harry whispered, hand carding through my hair. “I called Luke. He’s already here at the hospital.”

“What,” my voice cracked and I forced my eyes open to look at him.

Harry was sat at the side of my bed and when my eyes groggily opened he offered me a soft smile fingers messaging my scalp. I felt tired and so sore, I was desperate for a hug from him but even the thought of him touching me anywhere hurt.

“Luke, I called him to tell him you were in labour and he said that he was already here with Carly. Their little boy was born yesterday.”

“’s not fair.” I slurred, reaching a hand up and dropping it over his. My hold was light and Harry frowned at it. Whether he was upset at my hold or the entire situation we were in I don’t know and I was too tired to think about it.

Harry shook his head and pulled my hand down to press a kiss against the back of it, careful to avoid hitting the IV. “I know but we can make the most of it. We’re married now. She’ll still have my name and I’ll be her guardian. It’s going to be fine.”

“Next one is yours.” I smiled up at him, fighting to keep my eyes open.

Harry chuckled quickly and pressed another kiss to the back of my hand. “I hope so. You’re stuck with me now Mrs Styles. Go back to sleep baby.”  

…

“Hm, you’re so perfect.” Harry said to Nora who was bundled up in his arms, wrapped tight in a pink fluffy blanket that Gemma had gotten her.

I was beyond tired and ready to go to sleep but Luke still hadn’t been in yet to see Nora and I wanted to be awake when he did. She was born only an hour ago and I already had to pass her over to someone else. It hurt my heart, I wanted to cry but I was to tired to even do that.

“I can tell Luke we need a few more hours.” Harry said, drawing my eyes from the little brown curls on Nora’s head up to his green eyes.

“No, it’s okay.” I shifted a bit so I could curl around the warmth of Harry’s back. He shifted Nora into one arm and reached back a hand to soothe it over my arm. “Want to get it over with so I can go back to sleep. Anne and Gemma don’t want to wait any longer either.”

Harry’s lips pulled up into a slight smile as he tugged the soft blanket up higher and tucked it around my neck. He had to be just as tired but he was soldiering on through it being the strong one out of the pair of us. A quick knock on the door caused me to jump and my heart beat picked up quickly and I was starting to feel sick.

“Do you want me to let him in?” Harry asked carefully, his arm tightening protectively around Nora.

I nodded at him and gave a final look at my little girl before Harry stood up and headed towards the door. My heart was still beating fast and I felt insanely nauseous. I hadn’t felt this sick since my first trimester.

Harry opened the door to Luke and I took in a deep breath to settle everything that felt off inside me. Luke looked a little pale and his hands were shaking as he slowly made his way into my room behind Harry so we were in the privacy of my room. Luke flicked his eyes up to Harry after staring at Nora, there was shock in his blue eyes.

“Do you want to hold her?” Harry asked Luke after a minute when he didn’t do anything.

I thought Luke would come in annoyed that Harry got to hold his daughter before he did but no, he was stood there like a deer in headlights not being able to decide who to look at. Luke nodded nervously and reached out his arms and very gingerly Harry transferred Nora over as I held on to a deep breath watching the interaction.

Nora fussed a little at the transfer but quickly settled into her dad’s arms as he tucked her up close to his chest. Harry swallowed deeply as he stepped backwards until he was sat back on the bed with me, his hand quickly finding mine, shaky fingers linking together.

Luke was quite for a moment, just admiring his little girl, finger stroking over her features before looking back up to me with tear coated eyes. “She’s beautiful Eve’s. Are you okay?”

“I’m fine,” I croaked out. “Tired and sore but okay.”

Five minutes hadn’t even passed and already I was desperate to have her back in my arms. I missed the warmth her little body gave me when I held her, even the smell of her and right now she felt too far away and out of my reach. Having Harry close really did help. I couldn’t imagine how I would be able to get through this without him here.

Luke nodded as he sat down in the chair that only recently had Grace in it. He cooed down at Nora and I heard her gurgle back up at him and my heart stuttered. This was going to be very difficult for me.

“It’s okay,” Harry leant over me, his voice dropping low so only I could hear him. “Just breathe, he’ll be gone in half hour and you’ll be holding her again.”

I nodded up at him, my hand tightening around his as I kept my mouth shut on what I really wanted to say. Every moment Luke held her made me feel like I was losing a bit of her love and even though it was selfish I didn’t care. I wanted to have the little perfect bundle all to myself.

“Have you thought of any names?” Luke interrupted the silence of the room.

Harry drew back from me with a tense look. Luke didn’t know I had already named her Nora, he also didn’t know that Harry and I were married and that I had changed my last name.

“Nora. We wanted Nora Anne, after Harry’s mum, but I understand why you wouldn’t want Anne but I really need her name to be Nora.” My voice cracked and I felt myself start to cry. I had my heart set on Nora and I wasn’t going to budge.

Luke sniffed and nodded at me. “What about her last name? That time at lunch, you said you wanted her to have yours.”

“I want to hyphen it with yours. Styles-Williams.”

Luke’s eyebrows furrowed and that seemed to be the first time that he forgot about the baby in his arms. “Your last name, not his.”

“Styles is my last name. We got married a few weeks ago.” I mumbled the words quietly but somehow Luke still heard me.

Luke cursed underneath his breath, running a hand over his face quickly. I could tell that this wasn’t something he expected to hear but I was happy that seemed to be the worst part of his reaction. The room was quiet for a few seconds, the only sound coming from the monitor I still had attached to my finger.

“I’m okay with Nora, I understand how important that is to you, I don’t think I can do anything about the last name. Maybe not the middle name.” Luke concentrated back down at Nora and the room was bathed back in awkward silence.

I could fight to get the middle name for Harry but not now. I was too tired and I wasn’t going to fight in front of Nora, even when she was this young.

…

Six months later:

“Do not throw up on me.” Harry said intently to Nora who was supposed to be having tummy time on the floor but was instead lying on Harry’s chest who was lying on the living room floor amongst all her toys.

Nora’s lips pulled up into a toothy smile and Harry smiled back at her despite how tense he was being with her only a few seconds ago. Shaking my head, I smirked down at the two of them over the top of the manuscript I was slowly making my way through. Harry and Nora made for great distractions.

“Once,” I said. “And it was your own fault for burping her without a towel.”

“It was Gucci,” he complained and quickly put his hand up to stop her from rolling off his chest.

A small chuckle passed my lips and Harry glared up at me beneath his long lashes. The dry cleaner got the stain out of the shirt so he didn’t have a reason to be bitter about the shirt anymore.

The little family moment we were having was quickly interrupted by a sharp knock at the door. Harry looked towards the door at the same time I did but not before he bought his hands up to drop them over Nora’s back as her smile quickly fell and she tried to snuggle into his chest.

Throwing the manuscript down onto the couch next to me I quickly hurried to the front door while Harry started to soothe Nora because the loud knocking was quickly unsettling her.

“Luke?” Luke was stood at the door, looking very frazzled and his hair had been ruffled up a lot as well. “What the hell. I told you to text before coming around.”

Luke pushed past me into the house, shaking his head quickly. “I know but I need to see her.”

“Luke she won’t go to you when you’re like this.” Hurriedly I followed behind him to where Harry was standing with Nora clutched protectively to his chest.

I had adapted to Luke being around so often again. The custody agreement was for one, three-hour visit a week but he was around three times a week to see Nora and I didn’t mind it. He was being a father and that’s all I wanted him to do.

When he came around like this, fuming and without any warning it was always a mess. Nora never wanted to go to him and she would just scream until she was blue in the face and back cradled in my arms.

“Give me my daughter Harry.” Luke seethed but Harry didn’t flinch.

“Calm down first.” Harry said evenly, hand gentle on Nora’s back.

My heart started to race as Luke’s anger grew tenfold. Nora could sense his feelings and she started to cry into Harry’s neck despite how much he attempted to soothe her.

“I don’t need to calm down she’s my fucking daughter and I want to hold her.” Luke’s hands came up and grabbed Nora around her sides trying to pull her back from Harry’s tight hold.

That was when I saw red and I shot myself across the room as quickly as possible to put myself between Luke and Nora. I didn’t care what was going on with him today, not that he ever told me what the problem was these days, but I wasn’t going to have him vent out all his issues with Nora so close.

“How many times do I have to tell you that I don’t care how often you come around to see her but you cannot see her when you’re this angry. If you want to hold her today go outside and calm down first.”

Luke scowled at me. “You can’t keep her from me Evie.”

Turning he stormed back out of the house, slamming the front door which caused me to flinch. Lifting a hand up I ran out over my face, my chest shaking with my heavy breathes as I heard the sound of tyres screeching out of the driveway.

“Evie,” Harry said softly and Nora’s loud cries drew me back to reality. Putting my hands up I tried to take her but Harry shook his head at me as well. “You need to calm down. You need to calm her down and you can’t do that when you’re like this.”

I cuddled her tight to my chest, pressing small kisses against the side of her head as I stepped back to be sat down on the couch. Harry followed, wrapping the both of us up in his strong arms as he settled next to us.

“He can’t come around when he’s like that. He could have hurt her.”

“I know,” I whispered into Nora’s hair.

She was very slowly starting to calm down but Harry was right. Luke took it one step to far, he could have really hurt her by taking her from Harry like he did but he didn’t even care. Whatever was happening in his life made him blind to the safety of his daughter.

Eleven Months:

My finger slid over my phone as if I kept looking at it I would magically receive a text from Luke. This wasn’t like him. I hadn’t seen him in two weeks. Nora didn’t seem fazed at all by the lack of visits but it was confusing me that Luke suddenly went from two visits a week to not showing up or even texting me back to see what was happening.

“Still nothing?” Harry asked, watching Nora with furrowed brows as she spooned her yogurt anywhere but into her mouth. It was dripping down her face onto her bib and coated her cheeks but she refused to let Harry help her.

“Nope,” I sighed dropping my phone down to the table. Leaning over I tried to take the spoon from Nora so she at least managed to get some food into her but she squealed and turned away from me as well.

“You’ve told him and you’ve told his mum. You can’t do anything more Evie, he needs to make the effort.” Harry picked up his own spoon from his bowl of cereal, eyes soft as he looked over at me.

I hummed resting my chin in my hands as I rested my elbows on the table. I wasn’t interested in my breakfast anymore, I felt to worried. Harry was right, I didn’t need to be worrying over this, I had done everything I could have. Nora’s first birthday was soon and I had invited Luke to come to her party but I hadn’t gotten a reply. I didn’t want Nora to look back on pictures of her first birthday and see her father wasn’t there and I felt all the weight of the situation was rested on my shoulders.

“It’s weird,” I said after a few moments of silence, my eyes watching Nora as she got sick of the spoon and started using her hands. I couldn’t even worry about the mess she was making; her mess would be easy to clean up. “He made so much drama about being in her life and he visited so much and now he’s just stopped. Something is wrong.” My eyes flicked over to Harry who looked as if he was thinking deeply into what I said.

“You’ve tried Evie, that’s all that matters. You’ve given him opportunities and he hasn’t taken any of them. His mum has tried so don’t blame yourself for his actions.” Reaching across the table Harry took my hand and gave it a reassuring squeeze.

Shaking my head, I ran my fingers over the back of his hand. “I don’t want him to hurt her.” I whispered.

Both of our eyes flicked back over to Nora and instantly I smiled. This tiny human being that was all smiles and covered in yogurt was my entire world and I didn’t want anything to hurt even if she was at an age that she wouldn’t remember ever being sad. She smiled back up at me and giggled as she put a handful of yogurt into her mouth, pride evaporating off her as if she were the smartest person in the room because of her actions.

She didn’t deserve this. She deserved to have order in her life and because of Luke and all the emotions he was going through, she wasn’t getting that. I had put all my feelings for Luke aside when she was born because I wanted what was best for her but sometimes it didn’t even seem like Luke cared. He wasn’t in the right state of mind to be a father and I felt horrible for doing this to my little girl.

What Nora really deserved was to have Harry’s name on her birth certificate and not Luke’s.
